content:
So you installed outlook and allowed it to change the default mail client.

Go to the settings on Thunderbird. ≡ > Settings

Search for system. Click the Check now button and see if that simple expedient fixes the issue.

creator: MattAuSupport

content:
I'd love to know what makes you think you have to donate because you definitely don't have to, you're merely asked to donate if you want, that's why it's a donation, not a purchase…

My first try was a new password because there was no indication of which was required. […] Do I really have to have a password on account setup?

If you're trying to set up a mail account in Thunderbird, of course you'll have to provide the password for that account. That's what the password is for, so nobody can access your mail without knowing the password. If you didn't have to use your password for that, then anyone would be able to get access to your mail by merely knowing your email address and setting up your mail account on his/her computer… The indication of which password is required is the very fact that you're trying to get access to your mail account. What other indication would you need?

You appear to not be correctly configuring the account with the right settings, though. Maybe you're trying to configure automatically an account that you have to Configure manually because Thunderbird doesn't know what the settings for that account should be, and that's why the set up process may fail even if you're using the right password, but you'll have to give more details about which is your email provider and the settings you're trying to use for anyone here to be able to assist. A screenshot (without showing any passwords) would help…
creator: DavidGG

content: In TB, a .msf file is an index of mail that is stored in the mbox file with the same name, e.g. folder.msf and folder (no extension). If you can recover the mbox file, it can be imported to TB - the .msf file is unnecessary as the mbox contains all the message content. The .msf is automatically recreated after mbox import.
creator: sfhowes

content: Sounds like you have a Message Filter not working as expected…

content: Please post your Troubleshooting Information. At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡, then select Help > Troubleshooting Information. Press the "Copy text to clipboard button" and paste the information into your reply.
